name: Document Title: ITP-169-RAIL-BRUNT-Rail Delineation Permanent Fencing
ITP Description: BRUNT-Rail Delineation Permanent Fencing
ITP approved for use by: Jon De Castro
Reference - IFC Drawings VicRoads Section 610, VicRoads Section 630, VicTrack STD_C0031
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Mix is Registered with VicRoads.
○ Minimum Strength of 20MPa concrete to be used as per IFC drawings.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Supplier Material Conformance Certificate, Delivery Dockets

Acceptance Criteria - All weld mesh fences and gates to be galvanised steel with black powder coat unless nominated otherwise on fencing plans. Galvanised coating shall comply with AS/NZS 4792 with a coating class of HDG 300 mimum
Method - Document review, Visual and Measure
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Supplier Material Conformance Certificate, Delivery Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services, post locations, refuge bays.
○ Offset checked against the running edge prior to installation of posts.
○ Engineer to verify alignment of posts using string line or equivalent.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation for post foundation must not undermine track, footing of existing structures and comply with the PTDT requirements.
○ Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
○ Excavation must use Non Distructive Digging in the rail corridor
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - All post (fence and gate) foundations to be inspected by the site team prior to installing the posts. All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
○ If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Fencing must be a minimum 2m away from OHW Structures.
○ Where temporary fence is in proximity of the OHW Structure, the OHW Structure is to be cladded with timber for a minimum height of 2.4m from ground level.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Typical Footing: Footing dimension 600mm deep, 200mm diameter
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete cast in one continuous operation to be tested at a frequency as shown below:
– For each additional 50m³ and additional sample shall be taken.
– Where IFC nominates minimum strength development, ensure strength is verified by additional cylinder or other approved method (such as maturity testing).
– Each sample shall consist of 1 no. slump or spread test and 3 no. compressive strength cylinders minimum.
– Compressive strength cylinders = 1 no. 7 day strength, 2 no. 28 day strength.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off, Concrete Pour Record
Acceptance Criteria - Maximum post spacing to be 2.405m. Spacing may be locally decreased as required to avoid existing services
○ Max. post height 1800mm above ground level
○ Vertical Tolerance: ±20mm from the design line.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Chain-wire mesh 1800x50x2.50 to be fixed to fence post with Tek Screw and 25mm U-Clip
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - 50 SHS x 2.5 Diagonal bracers to be installed at vehicle gate as per IFC Drawings
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - 100mm Seperation Gap between the existing fence and new fence to be installed.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Gates to be fabricated to the installed gate posts with equal spacing welded mesh.
○ Braces and Verticals Mesh to be installed as per the IFC
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Vertical gaps between finished surface level and the bottom of the fence panel are to be 50mm minimum to 150mm maximum
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
